title: What’s Happening in Space Policy July 2-15, 2023

title: ESA’s Euclid on Its Way to Study the “Dark Universe”
summary: ESA’s Euclid spacecraft is on its way to the L2 Lagrange point where it will spend six years collecting data to help scientists understand the nature of dark energy and […]

title: Falcon 9 launches ESA’s Euclid space telescope
summary: A European mission to unravel some of the biggest mysteries in the universe is underway thanks to a launch from an American rocket.

title: ESA's Euclid Embarks on a Momentous Journey to Unravel the Mystery of Dark Matter and Dark Energy
summary: At 11:12 AM ET, SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket took to the Florida skies from SLC-40 with ESA's Euclid Telescope onboard. This mission, a rather unique one to add to the now seemingly never-ending list of SpaceX launches, saw F9 loft Euclid to an L2 orbit, the same orbit as NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, and a first-of-its-kind mission for SpaceX.

title: SpaceX launches ESA’s Euclid Telescope to explore the dark universe
summary: SpaceX launched its 45th mission of the year, carrying the Euclid telescope from the European Space Agency (ESA). Liftoff was Saturday, July 1, at 11:12 AM EDT (15:12 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) in Florida.

title: NASA to add fourth pair of roll-out arrays to ISS
summary: After completing an upgrade to the International Space Station’s power system in June, NASA is moving ahead with plans to add two more solar arrays to the station.

title: United Launch Alliance delays maiden Vulcan Centaur launch
summary: Following the anomaly investigation into the Centaur V upper stage, United Launch Alliance is de-stacking the Vulcan Centaur rocket and shipping the...

title: China’s Changguang Satellite demonstrates space-to-ground laser links
summary: A Chinese satellite manufacturer and constellation operator says it has successfully demonstrated space-to-ground high-speed laser communications which could help China break bottlenecks in getting data from space down to the ground.

title: AST SpaceMobile hunting for more funds following stock sale
summary: AST SpaceMobile is continuing to search for funds ahead of deploying commercial direct-to-device satellites next year after getting more breathing room with a $60 million discounted share sale.

title: NASA Hosts OSIRIS-REx Sample Lab Media Day in Houston
summary: Ahead of the first asteroid sample collected by the U.S. arriving on Earth in September, media are invited on Monday, July 24, to see NASA’s newly-built OSIRIS-REx Sample Curation Laboratory where the agency will study the sample at its Johnson Space Center in Houston.
